note.p: Death: His house, Devonshire Street, Portland Place, London (29 April 1833)
Burial Place: Family vault, Church of St Mary's, Aldermanbury
Education: Apprenticed in Londonderry; Guy's Hospital, London; MD (1795, King's College, Aberdeen); Hon. MD (1831, Dublin)
Career: Assistant Surgeon, Haslar Hospital (1777); contracted typhus fever at Winchester, but survived; contracted influenza, and died (1835); one of the founders of the Geological Society
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc 1832-1833 No 14 pp 227-228
References: N G Coley, 'The Animal Chemistry Club; Assistant Society to the Royal Society' in NR 1967 vol 22 pp 173-185
